title: 105_s170
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends definitions in the Wire and Electronic Communications Act to include communication made through a clone pager. It also prohibits the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers without authorization. Additionally, it amends Chapter 206 of the Act. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. The amendments also extend to section 3121, updating the terminology to encompass clone pagers alongside trap and trace devices. The amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code include the addition of clone pagers alongside trap and trace devices. This extends to various sections within the chapter, allowing for the authorization of clone pagers in certain circumstances. The amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code now include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. This allows for the authorization of clone pagers in specific situations, with relevant information certified by the Government or State law enforcement. The amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code now include clone pagers alongside trap and trace devices. This allows for the authorization of clone pagers in specific situations, with relevant information certified by the Government or State law enforcement. The amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code now include clone pagers alongside trap and trace devices. A Federal court may order a provider of a paging service to furnish all necessary information and technical assistance for the operation of a clone pager unobtrusively. The amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code now include clone pagers alongside trap and trace devices. Clone pager is defined as a numeric display device that receives communications intended for another numeric display paging device. The Senate passed the amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code on November 7, 1997.
